description: ), 1BR, 1800, Enjoy the splendor of historic Beacon Hill in this one bedroom apartment right on Charles Street. All of Boston is at your fingertips with the Charles/MGH stop on the Red Line of the T only blocks away and the Green Line about a 10 minute walk. Grocery shop at Whole Foods on Cambridge Street,  or try the local establishments: Savenor's,  where Julia Child shopped,  at the top of Charles Street,  or DeLuca's market at the bottom. Boston Common and the Public Garden are only a couple blocks away,  and Charles Street is lined with shops boutique and antique,  along with some of the best restaurants in the city. The entrance to the Esplanade is at the top of Charles Street as well,  ideal for evening strolls along the Charles River.The apartment is on the third floor over an art gallery boasting lots of natural light through large front and rear windows and hardwood floors throughout. Crown moldings,  built-in bookshelves,  and a fireplace with mantle are indicative of the historic nature of the neighborhood while studio lighting,  a large mirror over the fireplace,  and granite in the kitchen provide contemporary accents. Built in 1850,  the building is in excellent condition.Guest AccessThe bedroom has a double bed and dresser with built-in bookshelves. The open floor plan living room/kitchen includes a queen futon,  two chairs,  a coffee table,  and dining table and chairs. The kitchen is stocked with cookware,  servingware,  plates,  glasses,  mugs,  etc.,  and includes refrigerator,  electric stove with hood,  microwave,  and dishwasher.Interaction with GuestsI look forward to welcoming you when you arrive and will be in touch to make arrangements for your arrival. Other than that,  I live about 20 minutes away but I'm available as you need me by cell,  text,  or email.The NeighborhoodBeacon Hill is quintessential Boston. One of the most historic parts of the city,  it is home to some of its most famous residents,  including John Kerry,  who lives just up the hill. Be sure to visit Boston Common and say hello to the ducklings in the Boston Garden. Go grocery shopping at Savenor's,  Julia Child's old haunt. Grab a pint at Cheers,  just around the corner. And enjoy some of the best food in town at Toscano or a laid back brunch at Paramount.Getting AroundParking is difficult on Beacon Hill,  but who would want to drive in Boston anyway? It's a walking city,  and if it's too far a walk,  the public transit is fantastic. The apartment's closest T stop is on the Red Line at Charles/MGH,  but the Boylston and Arlington stops on the Green Line are only a 10 minute walk and the Chinatown stop on the Orange Line is 12 minutes.Other Things to NoteI love Boston and love helping people get to know it. I've lived here nine years now and have a pretty good feel for the place. I'm happy help you plan your visit,  as much or as little as you like.

Thanks.Hello potential roommate! Please take the time to READ THE ENTIRE AD CAREFULLY. Once you reach the bottom,  you will likely know if this place is the right fit for you or not. If it's the right place for you,  we're more then eager to hear from you ASAP. If not,  we wish you the best of luck with your search. Thanks a million for taking the time to read the entire ad (to save us both the time and trouble if it's not a good fit). :)GREAT LOCATION: We are two people with a spacious,  nicely furnished,  and recently renovated Victorian in a great,  safe & historical neighborhood with tree-lined streets. Seven (7) minute walk to Red Line Train (Wollaston) and to charming Wollaston Center with shops,  restaurants,  bars,  gym,  library,  post office,  etc. There is a 24 hour supermarket and a 24 hour CVS just a hop and skip away. You can even walk to the beach! Nearby Quincy Center also has lots of nightlife and diverse restaurants! Drive to Downtown Boston in just ten (10) minutes - or commute by train to Boston in just 15 minutes. Walk,  bike,  hike,  or jog at the Blue Hills; Neponset Park; or Wollaston Beach!LARGE BEDROOM: The room is large,  nicely furnished,  has hardwood floors,  brand new over-sized window; great closet space; and has cable. you can watch the sun rise/set from your bedroom window,  and has a lovely tree view. Some extra storage space might be available. (Sorry,  but the place is for INDIVIDUALS only,  not couples. :-)RENT: Of 995 includes absolutely everything: HEAT,  HOT WATER,  GAS,  ELECTRIC,  LAUNDRY,  ULTRA HIGH SPEED/BROADBAND INTERNET 100MB (fastest),  FULL CABLE (All channels + On Demand),  NETFLIX/AMAZON PRIME STREAMING; TIVO; and even a PROFESSIONAL MONTHLY CLEANING ARE ALL INCLUDED!!!TWO LEVEL HOUSE: House is immaculate,  has high ceilings and hard-wood floors throughout; lots of windows and sunshine. It has been updated and is fully furnished - from leather sofa's and artwork; to t.v and stereo,  to dishes and pots & pans,  from brand new stainless steel fridge to new washer & dryer!COMMON AREAS: There are two levels of living space with nice views of back yard,  trees,  and glimpse of ocean! The second floor common area has a living room/media room with leather furniture and a huge,  flat screen with DVD and Tivo DVR; and a fully equipped,  eat-in kitchen with brand new stainless steel fridge! One and a half bathrooms and in house laundry (new efficiency washer/dryer)!BATHS: There are 1.5 baths to share.THE CURRENT ROOMMATES ARE: (three M & F in their 20s to 30s) friendly,  busy,  considerate,  open-minded,  and responsible professionals (some are also attending grad school). Please also be easy going and drama free and able to pay rent on time! There is no smoking,  no drugs,  and no parties on the premise (although the the occasional wine or beer or two (or a few! =) is o.k.PETS: Sorry,  no pets bigger then a Guinea Pig. (Little guineas are welcome,  but don't actually have any pets at all!)AVAILABILITY: Now (Also have a bigger place for February.)EASY COMMUTE TO: Downtown Boston,  Financial District,  State Street Corp,  South Station,  U-Mass,  Suffolk University,  Northeastern University,  Berkeley,  B.U,  Emerson College,  Harvard,  MIT,  ENC,  Quincy College,  Curry College,  Baptist College,  New England School,  Tufts University,  Bay State College,  Quincy Grad Student; Mass General (MGH),  Tufts New England Medical Center,  Boston Medical (BMC),  Caritas Carney Hospital (12Minutes),  Milton Hospital,  South Shore Hospital. On-site parking and/or garage space might also be available.FUNDS & PAYMENTS: 1st,  last,  and security deposit due at time of signing with some FLEXIBILITY (if needed) for the right person. Low-key,  drama-free,  considerate,  responsible,  clean and organized (outside of your own bedroom);5. Clean,  cozy and perfect for your stay in Boston! Located in the heart of Beacon Hill on a quiet residential street,  only a block & a half away from the Charles/MGH T (subway) stop. Centrally located near MGH,  the Esplanade along the Charles River,  Charles Street & Boston Common. Wifi and cable included,  with a laundromat located directly across the (URL HIDDEN) on Beacon Hill area:Charles Street (one block away from the condo!) offers lots of quant shops and great restaurants to choose from.75 Chestnut: located on Chestnut St. on the flat of the hill. Has a very good brunch and dinner menu. Typical American food that is made to perfection. A great place to have a couple drinks and grab some food in the neighborhood.Figs: great place for casual dining right on Charles St; has delicious upscale and interesting pizzas with a quaint atmosphere. Very reasonably priced for dinner as well!Finz: best sushi in the Beacon Hill neighborhood. Located on Cambridge Street just a 10 minute walk from the apartment,  Finz has delicious and reasonably priced sushi that can be for dining in or for take out.Paramount: very popular place for breakfast in Beacon Hill,  located right on Charles St. Typical eggs,  French toast,  etc. but very delicious! Get there early though as a line often forms around 10am on the weekends.Panificio: the closest restaurant/bakery to the apartment,  right across the street on Charles St. Serves food all day. Brunch is especially delicious and is usually pretty quick to order- I recommend the Huevos Rancheros. Lunch and dinner are good as well.Upper Crust: pizza shop located at the end of Charles St closer to the park. Delicious pizza that is great for takeout.

description: ), 2BR, 1700, Mature gay couple (30's and 50's) is seeking a short-term or longer term roommate for fully furnished bedroom. Available on Feb. 3rd,  2016. Located in the historic South End of Boston... Fully furnished,  with new,  high quality beds. 1st floor bedroom (3 story loft) with private bath for $1700 per month,  all inclusive. Quiet Newcomb Street... historic P.P. Caproni Loft with high end finishes. Located 4 minutes walk away from the intersection of Washington Street & Mass Avenue,  steps to some of Boston's best restaurants. 300 feet from the Silver Line T stop (takes you downtown and to the airport) and a quick walk to Boston Medical Center and Boston University South End campus. This stunning Multi-Level 2 Bed/2.5 Bath Loft condominium is in a converted 1904 brick building. Built out to perfection,  fulfilling the wish list of most persons. Maple floors,  exposed brick walls & soaring 18 and 14 foot chestnut-beamed ceilings. Double insulation in ceilings and walls offer great sound privacy. Abundant light from enormous windows. Gas fireplace. Custom steel railings and spiral staircase to lower bedroom (see photos). Chef's kitchen with Bosch double wall convection ovens,  Sub Zero refrigerator,  Bosch dishwasher,  Silestone quartz counters,  floor-to-ceiling maple cabinetry and large breakfast bar. Custom lighting. Newer washer/dryer in unit (inside the half bathroom). Master bedroom with unique en suite French limestone bath with multiple shower-heads and a hand held. Large second bedroom with unique en suite onyx tiled bath. Half bath off of kitchen/living area. Formal dining room adjacent to kitchen. Wired for sound in most rooms. Storage area for luggage. One full gated parking space included in rent,  located right next to the side entry door. Some of the additional features are a large custom made,  Zebra wood dining room table that easily seats 6 to 8,  an eight foot tall 19th century stain glass window over the fireplace,  custom cherry master bedroom bureaus and matching bathroom vanity and assorted original antique paintings,  prints and objet d'art. Central air conditioning/heat. One month minimum stay. Two month or longer stays discounted by $100 per month. $500 security deposit. If you stay two months or longer a last month's rent deposit is required. Quiet building with mostly owner occupants. Contact owner/roommate if you are highly qualified with excellent references and credit. No couples please. For your information: One of the roommates is living in Florida for the winter and the other works full time and goes to Harvard part-time at night,  so lots of privacy.Paul/owner. Thank you. show contact info

description: ), 2BR, 800, I am a senior (m) about to graduate with my BFA in Painting. I have a beautiful loft in Union Square,  Somerville with an extra room and I'm looking to find a cool roommate. The loft has 14ft ceilings,  10Ft tall windows with a beautiful view,  washer and dryer,  and art gallery in complex,  located in a very cool artists community (which also includes many scientists as we are right near MIT). My loft is fully furnished except the room,  bring a bed etc with you. Unlike most of Somerville there is extensive parking available here with a residents permit and you can rent a dedicated spot for a very reasonable rate here on the property. Heat,  hot water,  trash pick up,  on site management during business hours,  plowing all included in the rent. I do not subscribe to cable TV,  I choose instead to keep it simple and just have internet services in my home. The second room,  which is the roommate bedroom,  is a loft style space and I will work with my new roommate to close it off for more privacy. Other details about this unique place can be discussed in person. As for pets,  I have one kitten and cannot add any additional pets.If you are interested,  please write to me with details about yourself,  how you like to have your home set up,  what you would prefer/dislike in a roommate situation.In the backyard of MIT,  close to Harvard,  ample bike and car parking,  beautiful community outdoor space,  on site art gallery and artists association. Across from Star Market,  Target,  Golds Gym,  quick walk to Lechemere T green line,  Sullivan Sq orange line,  and many buses (CT2 express to Longwood/MassArt/Mass College of Pharmacy,  Harvard Medical) etc). Only 2 miles to the heart of downtown boston,  a few blocks from 93. A 12-15 minute bike ride to BU Boston University Charles River campus. Kendall Square,  close to Museum of Science,  Inman and Central Square as well.

description: 'T GET BETTER! 2BR w Central AIRUNIT LAUND,  Private ROOF DECK (South End - 9/1/16), 2BR, 3300, ID: 1081525Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $3300 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: September 1stBeds: 2Baths: 1Pet: No PetFeatures: A/C Alcove Central Air Ceramic Tiles Deck Dishwasher Disposal Eat-in Kitchen Fireplace (Decorative) Granite Counter Tops Hardwood Floors High Ceiling Laundry in Unit Microwave Modern Bath Modern Kitchen New/Renovated Bath New/Renovated Kitchen New Appliances Private Roof Deck Stainless Steel Appliance(s) StorageEnormous Garden Level Two Bed,  One Bath Apartment with Private Landscaped Garden/ Patio in South End.This large two bedroom apartment is fully renovated with granite countertops,  stainless appliances garbage disposal,  and a new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  dish washer,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout unit. There is a large private garden level patio dedicated solely to this apartment. The patio area is perfect for outdoor entertaining and is landscaped with patio pavers and has a beautiful mature oak provide a nice shade in the summer months. The apartment has a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system.he building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete historic preservation converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating systems,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone through away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options. The Washington Stop on the Silver Line is 200' from the property,  there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.This location offers a multitude of transportation options (silver line,  bus,  zip car,  hub way) and is ideal for medical professionals practicing at the hospital two blocks away,  professionals commuting downtown and students studying at any of the many universities in the direct vicinity.
